headline: USCD finalises $6.2bn subsidy for Micron Technology
summary: The new funding includes $4.6bn for New York and $1.5bn for Idaho to support semiconductor production.

headline: 2 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks That Are Screaming Buys in December
summary: Market researcher IDC forecasts that global AI-related spending could hit $337 billion next year and jump to a whopping $749 billion by 2028.  As a result, technology companies selling AI-related hardware and software should ideally witness healthy growth in their businesses next year.  Micron Technology may not have set the stock market on fire this year as shares of the chipmaker have gained 18% in 2024, losing momentum in the second half of the year despite posting solid results of late, but that's good news for investors looking to buy an AI stock at a reasonable valuation.
